alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 10:13AM CDT until May 06 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Harrison County in southern Mississippi... Northeastern Hancock County in southern Mississippi... Western Jackson County in southern Mississippi... * Until 1100 AM CDT. * At 1013 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles west of Saucier to near Bay St. Louis, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, St. Martin, Diamondhead, D`iberville, Latimer, Lyman, Saucier, Gulf Hills and Gulfport Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 17 and 51. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 4. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in New Orleans.
